section.title: Set up Automatic Runtime Detection
section.para: JBoss Developer Studio has automatic runtime detection for finding runtime servers. This can be set up to scan locations for runtime servers when a new workspace is created or the IDE starts.

You may have already set this up during the installation process with the JBoss Developer Studio installer. If you have not set this up or you installed JBoss Developer Studio though Eclipse Marketplace, follow the procedure below to set up automatic runtime detection.

step.para: Click Window→Preferences, expand JBoss Tools and select JBoss Tools Runtime Detection.
To add a path for scanning, click Add and select a folder from which recursive scanning should commence. JBoss Developer Studio scans this folder and any subfolders to check for new runtime servers.

If new runtime servers are found, you can create instances of them. Select the check boxes of the runtime servers you want to create and click OK. If no runtime servers were found or you do not wish to create any instances click Cancel. In all cases, the path is added to the list of paths for scanning.
If you want this path to be scanned for runtime servers each time the IDE starts, select the Every start check box for the new path.
Click Apply to save any new paths and click OK to close the Preferences window.
